channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flags at risk of falling on to carriageway, 19th October
item.description:
The flags that are cable tied to the railing along Wood Lane, above the A2, have come undone and are hanging on by a single corner, putting them at risk of coming completely undone and falling on to the carriageway below and potentially causing a crash, should they land on a moving vehicle
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wood Lane, Darenth, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees Tyler Street, 19th October
item.description:
The three acacias on the southern part of Tyler Street are overgrown. They are a threat to safety when wind is blowing. The branches threaten to cut the telephone/optical fiber lines (see pictures).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62, Tyler Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin still here - reported as fixed but was just moved slightly further down the road!, 19th October
item.description:
Clearly fly tipped as it’s been abandoned for so long. Never been emptied or fixed - just moved slightly further down the road. Coffee cups, dog soil bags plus further rubbish now overflowing onto the surrounding pavement. Becoming a hazard. Already reported.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avery Hill Road, Avery Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lamp providing no light, 19th October
item.description:
Street lamp totally obscured by evergreen foliage and has been for a long time. Owner of the property responsible in Norlands Gate does not seem interested in remedying the problem. As a result there is effectively no street lighting at the bottom of Norlands Crescent.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norlands Crescent, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fibrous lagging, 19th October
item.description:
A lot of - what i think is - insulation material and plastic bagging dumped over the fence, past the old station masters house. Looks like wool. Not sure if it its supposed to be there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wells Park Road, Forest Hill, London

item.title: Dumped vehicle. Untaxed and no MOT, 19th October
item.description:
Again another vehicle dumped in the carpark. Red Citeron with flat front tyres and filled will furniture. Please note we know where these vehicles originate from and once reported they do tend to remove the licence plates. A dumped White Citeron is parked in private property of Austen Appartments and belong originiates from the same people. But cannot be removed due to being on private land apparently. Vehicles just get clamped and takes ages to be removed and then the same thing happens again. Please take action against the originators.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Wadhurst Close, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
